lexUnit.name: conceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise in the mind; imagine.

sentence.text: In the conditions that prevailed in mid-January this year , it is difficult to conceive just how much water was flowing through the Tay before striking south and on to Perth .
The mind that can not conceive the benefits to accrue by a coming together and a binding by paternal ties of a people having common sympathy must be wayward indeed .
He conceived his mission to be a religious one , ` to reduce Dissenters unto the CHURCH " .
Gandhi in fact does conceive the purpose of life to be to know the Self , which for him is equivalent to realizing God or knowing the Truth .
It sat upon an ancient heathen site , a site far darker than anything I could ever have conceived and it instantly became part of my well of strength .
The carriages stationed there are the most dumpy vehicles , I conceive , of their kind , in Europe .
It is even possible to conceive of holding your own in a conversation in which all you do is repeat aspects of what the other person has just said .
` I ca n't conceive of making films without thinking about what I 'm doing .

I know it is difficult to discuss a scientific topic nowadays without dragging in recombinant DNA somehow , but I can not conceive of even the most tenuous connection between genetic engineering and the quantum theory .
Causes , like the other conditions which enter into causal circumstances , are at bottom conceived by us to be certain spatio-temporal items , individual properties .
Look I can not conceive of development taking place on this land without coming into conflict with those policies .
Britain defines it in terms of competition and free trading ; most of the other countries conceive of it in terms of minimum operating standards .
They can not conceive the rest of the country is not in the same shape . "
The British hardly conceived the French could be defeated and few Americans expected to be embroiled in a global war .
No matter how drunk I was , I can not conceive I could possibly have shown any interest in the Party 's literature service .
We can not even start to conceive what conditions might be like in that universe , but there is no reason to conclude , point-blank , that it does not exist .
A year later the student can not conceive why he had such difficulty and suspicion about the nature of vectors .
There is also a difficulty in conceiving that the observed complexities of animals and plants could have arisen in this way .
He could not conceive that anything really serious could be worrying his friend .
None of us can conceive that we might die before our parents .
It corresponds to what Gandhi conceives to be necessary in the quest for Truth .
The courts will ascribe what they conceive to be the correct meaning to that term .
They were restoring a measure of dignity , conceived to have been taken from them , by withdrawal into injured and strategic silence .
